title: The Emergence of Smart Load Panels | ProBuilder - Pro Builder
summary: The article discusses the introduction of smart panels by companies like Leviton, SPAN, and Schneider Electric, to enable energy management and efficiency in homes.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as the smart panels contribute to energy efficiency and sustainability goals by increasing energy management and reducing carbon footprint.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of smart panels by companies like Leviton, SPAN, and Schneider Electric represents a business innovation in terms of new or improved products that differ significantly from previous offerings in the market.
green_product: TRUE. The smart panels introduced by Leviton, SPAN, and Schneider Electric are designed to significantly reduce environmental impacts throughout the product life cycle by enhancing energy efficiency and enabling better energy management.
green_process: TRUE. The implementation of smart panels in homes, as described in the article, represents a green process innovation as it aims to minimize environmental impacts, reduce energy consumption, and enhance sustainability in residential electricity management.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 335313 - Switchgear and Switchboard Apparatus Manufacturing, 335314 - Relay and Industrial Control Manufacturing, 335999 - All Other Miscellaneous Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing, 238210 - Electrical Contractors and Other Wiring Installation Contractors
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not exhibit any signs of greenwashing as it discusses legitimate efforts by companies to introduce energy-efficient and sustainable solutions.

title: 'Does gas power have a role to play as the Island transitions to a net-zero emissions future?' - Jersey Evening Post
summary: The article discusses the future of gas and the energy transition in the Channel Islands, particularly focusing on the role of Island Energy Group and the potential shift towards renewables and net-zero goals.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 221210 - Natural Gas Distribution, 211111 - Crude Petroleum and Natural Gas Extraction, 221119 - Other Electric Power Generation, 221122 - Electric Power Distribution

title: Mama maker sets out expansion plans - Bangkok Post
summary: Thai President Foods plans to invest over 2 billion baht in expanding its production capacity for Mama instant noodles in the next three years, aiming for a 30% increase in output. The company is set to build a new factory either near the Mekong River or in the Eastern Economic Corridor, with operations scheduled to begin in 2026. Thai President Foods also aims to enhance its global market presence and introduce new products to existing markets while responding to evolving consumer demands.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 311812 - Commercial Bakeries, 311823 - Dry Pasta Manufacturing, 311823 - Sanitary Food Container Manufacturing, 333243 - Sawmill, Woodworking, and Paper Machinery Manufacturing
